name: AWS Services Overview.txt - Compute
description: This section outlines various AWS services related to compute resources. It covers serverless computing options like AWS Lambda and AWS Batch, as well as managed services like Elastic Beanstalk and Serverless Application Repository. It also mentions AWS Outposts, which allows running AWS services on-premises, and EC2 Image Builder for automating the creation of virtual machine images. The section seems to provide an overview of different compute offerings from AWS, ranging from fully managed to self-managed options.
capabilities: Automated virtual machine image creation (EC2 Image Builder)

name: AWS Services Overview.txt - Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2)
description: This section explains Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute (EC2), a cloud computing service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) that allows users to rent virtual computers (instances) on which they can run their applications. EC2 instances can be scaled up or down based on demand, providing flexibility and cost-effectiveness. The section also mentions that the organization is extensively using EC2 instances, with or without Auto Scaling groups, and with different instance classes and types.
use_cases: Deploying on-demand virtual machines (instances) with varying performance capabilities
Scaling compute resources up or down based on demand
Using Auto Scaling groups with EC2 instances
capabilities: Wide array of instance types and classes

name: AWS Services Overview.txt - AWS Lambda
description: This section explains AWS Lambda, a serverless computing service that allows running custom code in response to events or triggers without provisioning servers. It highlights Lambda's use with Python for automating tasks like snapshots, redirection, and notifications across AWS regions. The section also mentions AWS storage services for backup, archiving, and disaster recovery.

name: AWS Services Overview.txt - Storage
description: This section provides an overview of various storage services offered by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It covers different types of storage solutions, including object storage, file storage, and backup services, designed to meet various data storage and management needs.
capabilities: Centralized data backup and recovery (AWS Backup)

name: AWS Services Overview.txt - Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3)
description: This section explains Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), which is a highly scalable and durable object storage service provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS). It allows users to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere, making it suitable for various applications such as websites, mobile apps, corporate applications, and Internet of Things (IoT) devices. The section also mentions that S3 is widely used for storing logs, media files, and serving static data from S3 buckets.
use_cases: Storing application-related data like media and files
Serving static data from S3 buckets
Storage for websites, mobile apps, corporate applications, and IoT devices
capabilities: Supports storing and retrieving any amount of data

name: AWS Services Overview.txt - Database
description: This section provides an overview of various database services offered by AWS, including relational databases (RDS), NoSQL databases (DynamoDB), and caching solutions (ElastiCache). It explains the purpose and key features of each service, and mentions some specific use cases within the organization. The section also briefly touches upon networking and content delivery services like VPC, CloudFront, and Route 53.
use_cases: Running production databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) on RDS
Storing application credentials and configurations in DynamoDB (Credstash/Kubestash)
Using AWS Redis (ElastiCache) for production cluster caching
Hosting static content and serving as a reverse proxy for packagist using CloudFront
Managing DNS routing to AWS resources/applications via Route 53
capabilities: Relational Database Service (RDS) for setting up, operating, and scaling relational databases
DynamoDB as a fast, fully managed, and flexible NoSQL database
ElastiCache for high-performance, cost-effective, and scalable caching solutions (Memcached, Redis)
Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) for defining a virtual network within AWS cloud
CloudFront as a fast content delivery network (CDN) for low latency and high transfer speeds
Route 53 as a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service
